Description: Beads made in different shapes and materials. A: 7 flattened spherical beads with a slightly higher part in the middle, made of turquoise. B: Conical flower bead made of red faience, flattened at the base and textured at the upper side. C: One larger disc-shaped bead made of turquoise faience. D: One cylindrical bead made of light blue faience, eroded to white. E: One disc-shaped bead with deep notches at the outer face, made of light green faience. F: Two ovoid beads, broken into several fragment, probably made of glass, slightly corroded now. G: Three segmented cylindrical beads, only two or three segments preserved, one made of red faience, the others in white faience. H: Two short cylindrical beads made of faience. I: One ring-shaped bead made of glass? or similar paste, grey with a pearlescent layer. J: One ring-shaped bead made of gold. K: 133 disc-shaped beads, made of light blue (7), white (90), black (10) and red (26) faience and two fragmented ones. L: Four very small fragments of corroded copper, probably a wire.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Temple East Sanctuary
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
